outputs.output_descr:
The first phase of the 'Innovations for Women's Empowerment in Southeast Anatolia' project was implemented from March 2008 to May 2012, with a view to strengthen the capacities at the local level and strengthen sustainability of the initiatives. It achieved an important set of results as outlined in the present document and forms the basis for the development of this second phase. Building on the first phase the project at hand has two main objectives:
1-Increasing women's individual productive and social capacities and enterprise level management skills to empower women within their communities
2-Increasing women's income through entrepreneurship and increased employment opportunities
The project will aim at building and disseminating knowledge for policy making while achieving results at the local level.

project_descr: This project will aim at increased productive capacities of women in Southeastern Anatolia and strengthen sustainability of the existing enterprises and facilities managed by women
